Parker's Place

Jefferson City, MO

Stay at Parker’s Place and discover Jefferson City’s history. Built in 1905 by Lester S. Parker using prison labor, Parker’s Place overlooks the oldest state prison west of the Mississippi River. Nestled on historic crossroads of Capitol Avenue and LaFayette Street, Parker’s Place is a destination for families and friends to connect in the capital city of Missouri.

Opening in October of 2021, plan a stay to enjoy all that Jefferson City has to offer. From downtown shopping and restaurants, to historical tours of the Capitol and old Missouri State Prison, to bike rides on the Katy Trail – come see what Jefferson City, and Parker’s Place has to offer.
